content:
Welcome to #Death on FHIR.

Description: Discussion around the FHIR profiles for the exchange of mortality data
Now, we have a channel for Death on FHIR. Yay~!!! This is Myung Choi from Georgia Tech. Adam, thank you for creating this channel !!!

Let's use this thread to all introduce ourselves when we join.

I'm a Research Scientist I at Georgia Tech. We at Georgia Tech work with Paula Braun on a large scale initiative to bring
automatic APIs to death reporting, as well as using EHR/FHIR data to help inform the death record process.

We have had 2 implementors workgroups, and we had lots of enthusiasm from other groups too. Looking forward to seeing you all again!

Thanks Michael, I suppose this is long overdue,
I'm a Lead Software Engineer At The MITRE Corporation.
We've been working hard on the VRDR IG, check it out at: http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/vrdr/
Note IHE has a FHIR Implementation Guide -- Birth and Fetal Death Reporting Enhanced Profile -- https://wiki.ihe.net/index.php/Birth_and_Fetal_Death_Reporting_Enhanced_Profile

Note IHE has a FHIR Implementation Guide -- Birth and Fetal Death Reporting Enhanced Profile -- https://wiki.ihe.net/index.php/Birth_and_Fetal_Death_Reporting_Enhanced_Profile

@John Moehrke Thanks for bringing this to my attention. I will take a look.

FWIW - I'm not officially involved with this (yet), but I've worked with the weekly death master index data in a former life at Northwestern University and it's been a passion-project / special interest of mine since then. I'm very interested in making this data easier to access for medical researchers. Right now I'm still trying to understand all the moving parts of the system - any learning materials / insights / suggestions are appreciated.

Hi Michael,
Thanks for the opportunity for introductions. You know me but for others which may not, Catherine Cheney Business Systems Analyst Project Owner and Manager, NH State Department. Nice to hear from you, see you soon!
Glad to see you on here Catherine! @Prachi just brought to my attention there is also a zulip mobile app you can download. Just a heads up for everyone #Death on FHIR . Thanks, Prachi!

Hello everyone! Just a quick note to introduce myself- Prachi Mehta, Health Scientist (Informatics) joined CDC/NCHS/Division of Vital Statistics a couple of months ago. Working to support the interoperability work with state programs. Look forward to meeting everyone in Ohio.
